title: Former NFL players plead guilty in multimillion-dollar health care fraud scheme
description: Two-time Pro Bowl running back Clinton Portis and two other former NFL players have pleaded guilty for their roles in a nationwide health care benefit fraud scheme to submit false claims for payouts totaling about $3 million, the Justice Department said Tuesday.

title: Washington Post: Trump to endorse Wyoming lawyer in effort to primary Cheney
description: Donald Trump is planning to endorse a lawyer and former Republican Party official in Wyoming in an effort to primary GOP Rep. Liz Cheney, an outspoken critic of the former President who has drawn his ire for rejecting his claims of voter fraud in the 2020 election, The Washington Post reported Wednesday.

title: Should Bill Clinton say 'sorry' to Monica Lewinsky?
description: The premiere of "American Crime Story: Impeachment" on Tuesday night has placed the scandal of a president conducting an affair with a 20-something employee of the White House front and center again.

title: Elizabeth Holmes' trial begins with opening statements
description: Elizabeth Holmes and the US government are set to face off in a San Jose federal courtroom in the long-awaited criminal trial of the founder and former CEO of Theranos.

title: White House tells ex-Trump officials 'resign or be dismissed'
description: The Biden administration has told 11 officials appointed to military service academy advisory boards by former President Donald Trump to resign or be dismissed, a source familiar with the situation tells CNN's KFile.

title: Kellyanne Conway fires back after Biden admin. asks her to resign
description: The Biden administration told several ex-Trump officials to resign from military advisory boards, including Kellyanne Conway.

title: Nxivm co-founder Nancy Salzman sentenced to 3 1/2 years in prison
description: Nancy Salzman, who created Nxivm alongside Keith Raniere, was sentenced to 3 1/2 years in prison Wednesday.

title: Video shows person placing pipe bombs near RNC, DNC headquarters before Capitol riot
description: The FBI has released new video footage of a suspect accused of planting two pipe bombs near the Republican National Committee and Democratic National Committee headquarters in Washington, DC, the night before the US Capitol riot.

title: Before she died of Covid-19, she begged TikTok followers to get the vaccine
description: Megan Alexandra Blankenbiller was waiting to get vaccinated until she had convinced her family to do it together.

title: Delivery driver spots 2-year-old boy running across busy road
description: A delivery driver was making his last delivery for the night when he spotted a toddler running across a busy road. CNN affiliate KCAL/KCBS has the story.

title: See video FBI released of pipe bomb suspect
description: CNN's Jessica Schneider reports on new video released by the FBI showing the person suspected of planting two pipe bombs near the US Capitol on January 6.

title: Taliban fighters use whips against Afghan women protesting the all-male interim government
US sails ship through South China Sea days after China institutes new maritime ID rules
description: A US destroyer sailed near the Spratly Islands in the South China Sea on Wednesday, the US Navy's 7th Fleet announced, days after China imposed new maritime identification rules that include the disputed body of water.

title: Amanpour presses Murphy on withdrawal: 'What is America's role in the world?'
description: Christiane Amanpour speaks with Democratic Senator Chris Murphy about withdrawal from Afghanistan and what he thinks America's role in the world should be.

title: Time Out lists the 'world's best' cities for 2021
description: It was already world-famous thanks to its striking red-hued bridge, drool-worthy restaurant scene and booming tech industry -- and now San Francisco has been crowned the "world's best" city, according to Time Out.

title: 'Blues Clues' original host Steve Burns explains why he left the show
description: Thank you, Steve Burns for cluing us in on what happened when you left "Blues Clues."

title: Solar energy has the potential to power 40% of US electricity by 2035, new DOE report shows
description: A new report from the US Department of Energy shows that solar energy could play a massive role in transitioning the United States' power sector to clean energy.

title: Main suspect tells Paris attacks trial he's 'an Islamic State soldier'
description: A trial of unprecedented scale starts under high security on Wednesday to judge 20 men suspected of involvement in a jihadist rampage across Paris on November 13, 2015, the deadliest attack in peacetime France.

title: Jennifer Aniston unveils new hair care brand, LolaVie
description: Actress Jennifer Aniston, who made "The Rachel" one of the 1990s' most iconic hairstyles, is sharing her hair care secrets with the world.

title: Hear why Steve Burns left 'Blue's Clues' in 2002
description: "Blue's Clues" is celebrating its 25th anniversary, with a surprise appearance on social media by its original host Steve Burns.

title: Taliban fighters use whips against female protesters
description:
• Afghan cyclist's fears realized as Taliban aims to forbid women from playing sport
• Watch Amanpour press Murphy on withdrawal: 'What is America's role in the world?'

title: John Mulaney announces Olivia Munn pregnancy
description: Congratulations are in order for John Mulaney and Olivia Munn.

title: Russian minister Yevgeny Zinichev dies during training exercises in the Arctic
description: Russian Emergencies Minister Yevgeny Zinichev has died in an accident during training exercises in the Arctic, Russian state media RIA Novosti reported Wednesday, citing the ministry.

title: National insurance hike sets UK on path to record level of taxes
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson's plan to hike payroll taxes to raise billions in funding for health and social care will raise Britain's tax burden to its highest ever level, according to the Institute for Fiscal Studies.

title: Incredible images captured from above in this year's Drone Photo Awards
description: A turtle heading into the sea, a volcanic eruption and a spectacular sunset feature among the winners of the Drone Photo Awards 2021.

title: Under Xi Jinping, the private life of Chinese citizens isn't so private anymore
Teen sensation produces yet another upset to reach US Open semifinals
description: Unseeded teenager Leylah Fernandez continued her stunning run at the US Open with victory over Elina Svitolina to reach the semifinals.

title: PayPal snaps up Japanese buy-now-pay-later unicorn for $2.7 billion
description: PayPal is buying Japanese startup Paidy, marking the latest major tie-up in the fast-growing space of buy now, pay later companies.

title: How floating islands can make urban waterways green and clean
description: Many of the world's cities are built around waterways. Paris and the Seine, Allahabad, India and the Ganges, Cairo and the Nile -- these rivers, at one time the life-force of their city, are now so polluted they're unfit for swimming and host very little natural wildlife.

title: A dog that saved its owner's life appointed South Korea's first honorary rescue dog
description: A plucky four-year-old dog named Baekgu has shown once again why dogs are man's best friend.

title: California's wildfire season is 'far from over' as multiple massive blazes rage, official warns
British warships head for Pacific, won't return to UK for five years
description: Two Royal Navy patrol ships left the United Kingdom on Tuesday for a five-year deployment that will see them act as "the eyes and ears" of Britain from the west coast of Africa, to the west coast of the United States, according to a British Defense Ministry statement.

title: Fire at a prison in Indonesia kills at least 41 people
description: At least 41 prisoners have been killed and at least eight injured after a fire tore through an overcrowded prison block on the outskirts of the Indonesian capital Jakarta, police said.

title: Rapidly-intensifying Typhoon Chanthu headed for Taiwan and southern China
description: A typhoon headed toward Taiwan and the southern coast of China is rapidly gaining in speed and strength ahead of an expected landfall later this week.

title: Powerful earthquake strikes southwest Mexico
description: A powerful earthquake has struck the southwest of Mexico late Tuesday.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez slams Texas GOP governor's 'deep ignorance' on abortion
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez on Tuesday slammed Texas Republican Gov. Greg Abbott's "deep ignorance" on abortion after he defended the state's new six-week abortion ban earlier in the day.

title: Biden turns storm devastation into disaster-zone sales pitch for legacy bills
Children make up more than a quarter of the weekly US Covid cases, pediatricians' group says
National security police arrest organizers of Hong Kong's Tiananmen vigil
description: Four activists from the Hong Kong pro-democracy group that organizes the city's annual Tiananmen Square vigil were arrested early Wednesday morning, after the group refused to comply with a police order to submit information on national security grounds.

title: Britney Spears' father petitions to end her conservatorship
description: Britney Spears' fight to end her court-ordered conservatorship took an unexpected turn on Tuesday when her father and the conservator of her estate, Jamie Spears, filed a petition to end the arrangement.

title: Africa's most populous country may have to deal with serious separatism issue
description: Nigeria, Africa's most populous nation, has been crippled by multiple crises, including terrorism and unemployment. The country may now have another serious issue to deal with - separatism. It's an issue that has resurfaced and is being disseminated from the outside in. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports.

title: Mexico Supreme Court rules criminalizing abortion is unconstitutional
description: Mexico's Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that penalizing abortion is unconstitutional, a major victory for advocates of women's health and human rights in the majority Roman Catholic nation.

title: Myanmar's shadow government launches 'people's defensive war' against the military junta
description: Myanmar's shadow government has launched what it called a "people's defensive war" against the military junta, urging citizens across the country to revolt.
